RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR2
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI control register 2. After a value is written to a specific bit of SCI_CR2, the SCI activates, releases, or soft-resets the smart card. When the SCI is releasing the smart card, write operations on this register are ignored. In other cases, writing 1 to SCI_CR2[finish] enables the SCI to immediately send a card release timing.CAUTION
  • The software writes to SCI_CR2 only in appropriate card operation phases. An inappropriate write may result in an unexpected result.
  • The smart card can be soft-reset by software only after the card is activated.

Member.name: wreset
Member.description:
Soft reset on the smart card
0: invalid
1: soft-reset
Note: This bit can be written only after the activation timing is transmitted. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
Release operation on the smart card
0: invalid
1: released
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: startup
Member.description:
Activation operation on the smart card
0: invalid
1: activated
Note: This bit can be written only after the card reader detects a smart card. Otherwise, writing to this bit has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CLKICC
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card clock frequency register. It defines the clock divider of the external smart card. The frequency of the smart card clock is calculated as follows: FSCI_CLK = FREFCLK/2 x (clkicc + 1). FSCI_CLK indicates the clock frequency, FREFCLK indicates the frequency of the reference clock, and clkicc is the value configured in SCI_CLKICC[clkicc].

Member.name: clkicc
Member.description: Divider of the smart card clock (obtained by dividing the reference clock frequency). Its value range is 0?255.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: an SCI_BAUD cycle count register in an ETU. Its value range is 5?255 and is used to calculate the ETU as follows: ETU = (1 + baud) x value/FREFCLK. FREFCLK is the frequency of the reference clock, baud is the value configured in SCI_BAUD[baud], and value is the value configured in SCI_VALUE[value].

Member.name: value
Member.description: Number of SCI_BAUD cycles in an ETU

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BAUD
RegisterGroup.description: a baud rate clock divider register. It is used to calculate the ETU and its value range is 0x1?0xFFFF. For details about how to calculate the ETU, see the description of SCI_VALUE.

Member.name: baud
Member.description: Clock divider of the baud rate

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TIDE
RegisterGroup.description:
a TX/RX FIFO overflow threshold register.NOTE
The characters in the TX FIFO are removed only after data is successfully transmitted.

Member.name: rxtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCIRXTIDEINTR interrupt
When the number of characters in the RX FIFO is greater than or equal to SCI_TIDE[rxtide], the RX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

Member.name: txtide
Member.description:
Value for triggering the SCI TXTIDEINTR interrupt
When the number of characters in the TX FIFO is less than or equal to SCI_TIDE[txtide], the TX FIFO overflow interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STABLE
RegisterGroup.description:
a smart card insertion stable time register. After the SCI detects that the SCI_DETECT signal is valid, the signal must retain valid for the period (in second) specified by TSTABLE that corresponds to the value defined in the SCI_STABLE register. After the period specified by TSTABLE has elapsed, an interrupt is triggered, indicating that the smart card has been properly inserted. The value of TSTABLE varies according to counter:
  • When the entire internal debounce counter is selected (that is, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 0), TSTABLE is calculated as follows: TSTABLE = (1 + Stable) x 65535 x TREFCLK. TREFCLK indicates the SCI reference clock cycle (1/48 MHz), and stable is the value configured in SCI_STABLE[stable].
  • When the non-programmable part of the internal debounce counter is bypassed (that is, SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 1), TSTABLE is calculated as follows: TSTABLE = Stable x TREFCLK.

Member.name: stable
Member.description: Duration during which the card detection signal is held high

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATIME
RegisterGroup.description:
a smart card activation time register. SCI_ATIME[atime] corresponds to SCIATIME in Figure 11-6. It indicates the duration of each of the three phases during card reset and activation.NOTE
SCI_ATIME[atime] must be at least 40,000 smart card clock (SCI_CLK) cycles to ensure card reset. SCI_ATIME[atime] must also ensure power stability for the smart card.

Member.name: atime
Member.description:
Duration (SCI_CLK cycle count) of each of the three phases involved in the card activation timing
For details about the timing for resetting the smart card, see Figure 11-6.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card release time register. SCI_DTIME[dtime] corresponds to SCIDTIME in Figure 11-7. It indicates the duration of each of the three phases involved in card release.

Member.name: dtime
Member.description:
Duration (SCI reference clock cycle) of each of the three phases involved in the card release timing
For details about the timing for releasing the smart card, see Figure 11-7.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRSTIME
RegisterGroup.description: an ATR RX start time threshold register. SCI_ATRSTIME[dtime] corresponds to SCIATRSTIME in Figure 11-6. Based on the smart card clock, the register defines the time threshold from finishing smart card reset to starting to receive the first ATR character. If waiting for the ATR RX start signal times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[atrstoutim] is set to 1.SCI_ATRSTIME[atrstime] must be set to 40,000 SCI_CLK cycles by software.

Member.name: atrstime
Member.description: Timeout threshold (SCI_CLK cycle) for starting ATR reception

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRDTIME
RegisterGroup.description:
an ATR RX time threshold register. If the duration from receiving the first ATR character to receiving the last one exceeds the duration (in ETU) defined in this register, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[atrdtoutris] is set to 1.NOTE
  • Before using this register, set SCI_CR1[atrden] to 1 to enable the timeout count mechanism.
  • According to the protocol, it is recommended that this register be set to 19,200 ETUs (0x4B00).

Member.name: atrdtime
Member.description: ATR RX timeout threshold (in ETU), counting from the start bit of the first ATR character

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STOPTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a clock stop time register. When the smart card clock stops, it becomes invalid after the time defined in SCI_STOPTIME (SCI_CLK cycles) has elapsed. Then an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkstpris] is set to 1.According to the protocol, the minimum clock stop time is 1860 SCI_CLK cycles, that is, when SCI_STOPTIME[stoptime] is set to 0x744.

Member.name: stoptime
Member.description: Time (SCI_CLK cycles) for stopping the smart card clock

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STARTTIME
RegisterGroup.description: a smart card clock recovery time register. If clock recovery is enabled, data can be transferred between the smart card and the SCI after the time (SCI_CLK cycles) defined in SCI_STARTTIME has elapsed. Then an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkactris] is set to 1.According to the protocol, the minimum clock recovery time is 700 SCI_CLK cycles, that is, when SCI_STARTTIME[starttimr] is set to 0x2BC.

Member.name: starttime
Member.description: Duration (SCI_CLK cycles) from starting the card clock to activating data transfer between the SCI and the smart card

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RETRY
RegisterGroup.description:
an RX/TX retry times register. It defines the allowed number of TX or RX retry times. The details are as follows:
  • If SCI_CR0[txnak] is enabled, the SCI checks whether the RX end identifies a parity error. SCI_RETRY[rxretry] defines the maximum number of retry times allowed after a parity error occurs. If the maximum number of retry times is exceeded, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set to 1.
  • If SCI_CR0[rxnak] is enabled, the SCI checks whether a parity error occurs in the received data. SCI_RETRY[txretry] defines the maximum number of retry times allowed after a parity error occurs. If the number is exceeded but the RX error still persists, SCI_DATA[parity] is set to 1.

Member.name: rxretry
Member.description: Maximum number of RX retry times after a parity error occurs during reception

Member.name: txretry
Member.description: Maximum number of TX retry times after a parity error occurs during transmission

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description:
a character RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.SCI_CHTIME defines the maximum time interval (in ETU) between the start edges of two consecutive characters received from the smart card. If the character RX interval times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[chtoutris] is set to 1.CAUTION
  • The SCI_CHTIME register consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_CHTIMELS register and the upper 16-bit SCI_CHTIMEMS register. SCI_CHTIME does not immediately take effect after software writes to SCI_CHTIMEMS. SCI_CHTIME takes effect only after software writes to SCI_CHTIMELS. Therefore, you need to configure the upper 16 bits and then the lower 16 bits of SCI_CHTIME in sequence.

Member.name: chtimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the character RX interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: a character RX interval timeout threshold upper 16-bit register.

Member.name: chtimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the character RX interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description: a block RX interval timeout threshold lower 16-bit register.SCI_BLKTIME defines the maximum block RX interval (in ETU). The interval is counted from the start edge of the last character that is transmitted to the smart card to the time when the first character returned from the smart card is received.If the interval times out, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[blkoutim] is set to 1.CAUTIONThe SCI_BLKTIME register consists of the lower 16-bit SCI_BLKTIMELS register and the upper 16-bit SCI_BLKTIMEMS register. SCI_BLKTIME does not immediately take effect after software writes to SCI_BLKTIMEMS. SCI_BLKTIME takes effect only after software writes to SCI_BLKTIMELS. Therefore, you need to configure the upper 16 bits and then the lower 16 bits of SCI_BLKTIME in sequence.

Member.name: blktimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the block RX interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKTIMES is a block RX interval timeout threshold upper 16-bit register.

Member.name: blktimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the block RX interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: a character guard interval register. It defines the minimum extra guard interval (in ETU) between the start edges of two consecutive characters when the SCI is transmitting characters to the smart card. The character guard interval depends on the global interface byte TC1 (obtained from the ATR timing) defined in the protocol.

Member.name: scichguard
Member.description: Character guard interval (in ETU)

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: a block guard interval register. When the transfer directions of two consecutive characters are opposite, the interval between their start edges is the value defined in SCI_BLKGUARD.

Member.name: sciblkguard
Member.description: Minimum interval (unit: ETU) between two consecutive characters with opposite transfer directions

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RXTIME
RegisterGroup.description: an RX FIFO read timeout threshold register. When there are characters in the RX FIFO and the characters are not read within the period defined in SCI_RXTIME, the RX read timeout interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[rtoutris] is set to 1.CAUTIONNever set SCI_RXTIME[rxtime] to 0x0000 when you use the read timeout interrupt function of the RX FIFO.

Member.name: rxtime
Member.description: RX read timeout threshold (unit: SCI_CLK cycle)

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TXCOUNT
RegisterGroup.description: a TX FIFO data count register.CAUTIONIf an error defined in the T0 protocol occurs when characters are transmitted to the smart card, and the number of retransmission times exceeds the allowed value defined in SCI_RETRY, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set to 1. RegisterGroup.name: SPICR0
RegisterGroup.description: SPI control register 0.

Member.name: scr
Member.description:
Serial clock rate, ranging from 0 to 255
The field value is used to calculate the SPI TX and RX bit rates. The formula is as follows: Bit rate = FSPICLK/[CPSDVSR x (1 + SCR)]
CPSDVSR is an even number ranging from 2 to 254, and is specified by configuring SPICPSR.

Member.name: sph
Member.description: SPICLKOUT phase. For details, see section 11.8.3 "Peripheral Bus Timings."

Member.name: spo

Frame format
00: Motorola SPI frame
01: TI synchronous serial frame
10: national microwire frame
11: reserved

Member.name: dss
Member.description:
Data bit width
0011: 4 bits
1000: 9 bits
1101: 14 bits
0100: 5 bits
1001: 10 bits
1110: 15 bits
0101: 6 bits
1010: 11 bits
1111: 16 bits
0110: 7 bits
1011: 12 bits
0111: 8 bits
1100: 13 bits

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART data register that stores the received data and data to be transmitted. The RX status can be queried by reading this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs. That is, a data segment is received when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. That is, the RX data input signal retains low longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, data bits, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error (namely, stop bit error) occurs.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Data to be transmitted or received

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description:
an RX status register or error clear register.
  • It acts as the RX status register when being read.
  • It acts as the error clear register when being written.You can obtain the RX status by reading UART_DR. The break, frame, and parity status information read from UART_DR takes priority over that read from UART_RSR. That is, the status information in UART_DR updates faster than that in UART_RSR.
CAUTIONWriting any value to UART_RSR resets it.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, the contents in the FIFO remain valid. No data will be written to the FIFO and an overflow occurs in the shift register. In this case, the CPU must read the data immediately to spare the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
If the RX data input signal retains low longer than a full word transfer, a break error is considered. A full word consists of a start bit, data bits, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error of the received data occurs.
In FIFO mode, the error is associated with the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error
0: No frame error occurs.
1: An error occurs at the stop bit of the received data. The valid stop bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the TX holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
This bit is defined by the status of UART_LCR_H[fen].
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the RX holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the RX FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle status
0: The UART is idle or data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy transmitting data.
If this bit is set to 1, the status is retained until the entire byte (including all stop bits) is transmitted from the shift register.
Regardless of whether the UART is enabled, this bit is set to 1 when the TX FIFO is not empty.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: an integer baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description:
Clock divider corresponding to the integral part of the baud rate
All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FBRD
RegisterGroup.description:
a decimal baud rate register.CAUTION
  • The values of UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD are updated only after the current data transmission or reception is complete.
  • The minimum clock divider is 1, and the maximum clock divider is 65,535 (216 ? 1). That is, UART_IBRD cannot be 0, and UART_FBRD is ignored if UART_IBRD is 0. If UART_FBRD is set to 0x1E and UART_IBRD is set to 0x01, the integral part of the clock divider is 30 and the decimal part of the clock divider is 0.015625. Therefore, the clock divider is 30.015625.
  • UART baud rate = Internal bus frequency/(16 x Clock divider) = Internal bus frequency/(16 x 30.015625)

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description:
Clock divider corresponding to the decimal part of the baud rate
All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H, UART_IBRD, and UART_FBRD constitute a 30-bit register. If UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD are updated, UART_LCR_H must also be updated.

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity select
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 of this register are set to 1, the parity bit is 0 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1 and bit 7 are set to 1 and bit 2 is set to 0, the parity bit is 1 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 are cleared, the stick parity bit is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Count of bits in a transmitted or received frame
00: 5 bits
01: 6 bits
10: 7 bits
11: 8 bits

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
TX/RX FIFO enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
Whether a 2-bit stop bit exists at the end of a transmitted frame
0: There is no 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
1: There is a 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
The RX logic does not check for the 2-bit stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Parity bit select during data transmission and reception
0: The odd parity bit is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
1: The even parity bit is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
This bit is invalid when UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity check enable
0: The parity check is disabled.
1: The parity bit is generated at the TX end and checked at the RX end.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
Break TX
0: invalid
1: After the current data transmission is complete, the UTXD outputs low level continuously.
Note: This bit must retain 1 for at least two full frames to ensure that the break command is executed properly. In normal cases, this bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: a UART control register.To configure UART_CR, perform the following steps:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait until the current data transmission or reception is complete.Set UART_LCR_H[fen] to 0.Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable
0: disabled
1: enabled. Data can be transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data RX request can be sent only when the RX FIFO has free space.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request TX
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data TX ready
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is retained.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART RX enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the current data reception is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART TX enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the current data transmission is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable
0: disabled
1: UARTTXD output is looped back to UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception and transmission, the data transfer is stopped abnormally.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS
RegisterGroup.description: an interrupt FIFO threshold register. It is used to set the trigger threshold for the FIFO interrupt (UART_TXINTR or UART_RXINTR).

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
RX interrupt FIFO threshold. An RX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: RX FIFO ≥ 1/8 full
001: RX FIFO ≥ 1/4 full
010: RX FIFO ≥ 1/2 full
011: RX FIFO ≥ 3/4 full
100: RX FIFO ≥ 7/8 full
101?111: reserved

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
TX interrupt FIFO threshold. A TX interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: TX FIFO ≤ 1/8 full
001: TX FIFO ≤ 1/4 full
011: TX FIFO ≤ 3/4 full
010: TX FIFO ≤ 1/2 full
100: TX FIFO ≤ 7/8 full
101?111: reserved

Member.name: sofitpsync
Member.description:
0: The first port of the UTMI/ULPI PHY is not suspended no matter whether other SS ports are in the Rx.Detect, SS.Disable, or U3 state.
1: The first port of the UTMI/ULPI PHY is not suspended no matter whether other non-SS ports are suspended.
Note: This field is valid only when the USB controller is in host mode.

Member.name: u1u2timerscale
Member.description:
U1/U2 timer scale-down enable
0: enabled
1: disabled when GCTL bit[5:4] (ScaleDown) is X1

Member.name: debugattach
Member.description:
Debug
When this field is set to 1:
After the Ru/Stop bit in the DCTL register is set to 1, the SS controller enters the polling link state without detecting the connection of the remote device.
The timeout period for link LFPS polling is unlimited.
The timeout period for TS1 polling is unlimited.

Member.name: ramclksel
Member.description:
RAM clock select
00: bus clock
01: pipe clock
10: pipe/2 clock
11: reserved
Note: In host mode, hardware sets this field to 00 (the ram_clk connects to the bus_clk). Therefore, when the SS port is in P3 state, the PIPE clock is disabled, and the USB 2.0 port does not work.

Member.name: scaledown
Member.description:
Scale-down timing select
In high-speed, full-speed, or low-speed mode:
00: All scale-down timings are disabled, and the actual timings are used for simulation.
01: All scale-down timings excluding the timings related to the following functions are enabled:
-Speed enumeration
-HNP/SRP
-Suspend and resume in host mode
10: Only the scale-down timings related to the suspend and resume functions in device mode are enabled.
11: All scale-down timings are enabled.
For the SS mode:
00: All scale-down timings are disabled, and the actual timings are used for simulation.
01: The SS scale-down timings are enabled, including:
-The number of TxEq training sequences is decreased to 8.
-The LFPS polling burst time is reduced to 100 ns.
-The LFPS warm reset receive is reduced to 30 μs.
10: TxEq training sequences are not transmitted.
11: All scale-down timings are enabled.

Member.name: disscramble
Member.description:
Scrambling enable
1: disabled
0: enabled

Member.name: u2exit_lfps
Member.description:
U2 state exit signal
0: The link layer considers the 248 ns LFPS signal as an active U2 state exit signal.
1: The link layer waits 8 μs after detecting an active U2 state exit signal.

Member.name: gblhibernationen
Member.description:
Global hibernation enable
0: disabled. When the PMU accepts status switching between D0 and D3, the internal status of the core is not retained or restored.
1: enabled

Member.name: dsblclkgtng
Member.description:
Internal clock gating enable
0: enabled
1: disabled when the core is in LPM mode
Note: This field can be set to 1 after power-on reset.

Member.description: An OTG-related interrupt in the OEVT register is waiting for handling.

Member.name: bc_ip
Member.description: A BC-related interrupt in the BCEVT register is waiting for handling.

Member.name: adp_ip
Member.description: An ADP-related interrupt in the ADPEVT register is waiting for handling.

Member.name: host_ip
Member.description: An xHCI-related interrupt in the host event queue is waiting for handling.

Member.name: csrtimeout
Member.description: The duration of accessing registers by software exceeds the time defined by DWC_USB3_CSR_ACCESS_TIMEOUT.

Member.name: buserraddrvld
Member.description: GBUSERRADDR register validity indicator and start address for the error position.

Member.name: curmod
Member.description:
Current working mode
01: host mode
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GUCTL1
RegisterGroup.description: global user control register 1.

Member.name: ovrld_l1_susp_com
Member.description: Vendor's PHY. This field can be set to any value.

Member.name: loa_filter_en
Member.description: Port disable status detection. When this field is set to 1, the controller takes three consecutive cycles to detect the port status before the port is disabled.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GSNPSID
RegisterGroup.description: a Synopsys ID register.

Member.name: synopsysid
Member.description: The upper 16 bits indicate USB 3.0, and the lower 16 bits indicate 2.50a.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GUID
RegisterGroup.description: a global user ID register.

Member.name: userid
Member.description: User information including the system version and hardware configuration

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GUCTL
RegisterGroup.description: a global user control register.

Member.name: refclkper
Member.description:
Reference clock (ref_clk), in ns
For example, if ref_clk is 125 MHz, this field is set to 8 ns (1/125 MHz).

Member.name: noextrdl_
Member.description:
Extra delay between the SOF packet and the first packet
0: The host transmits the first packet 2 ms later after the SOF packet.
1: The host transmits the first packet after the SOF packet without delay.

Member.name: sprsctrltransen
Member.description:
Disperse control transfer enable
Some devices respond to the control transfer at an extremely slow speed. The devices are abnormal if multiple transfers are performed in a frame or micro frame. When this field is set to 1, the host controller disperses a control transfer in multiple frames or micro frames.

Member.name: resbwhseps
Member.description: 85% of the bandwidth is reserved for high-speed periodic endpoints.

Member.name: cmdevaddr
Member.description:
Device address mode
0: The device address is the slot ID.
1: The device address is incremented based on the address allocation command of each device.

Member.name: usbhstlnautoretryen
Member.description:
Automatic retransmission enable for host inputs
0: disabled
If an error occurs during host input transfer, the host automatically replies an ACK indicating termination to the device (Retry = 1 and NumP = 0).
1: enabled
If automatic retransmission is enabled and an error occurs during host input transfer, the host automatically replies an ACK not indicating termination to the device (Retry = 1 and NumP ! = 0).

Member.name: enoverlapchk
Member.description:
LFPS overlap signal detection enable
0: The LFPS overlap signal is not detected.
1: The LFPS overlap signal is detected to avoid glitches.

Member.name: extcapsupten
Member.description: External additional function enable

Member.name: csr
Member.description: Extra delay inserted between full-speed BULKOUT transfers

Member.name: dtct
Member.description:
Rough timeout period that the device responds to the host. If this field is set to 0, the timeout period is defined by the DTFT; if this field is not 0, the timeout period is as follows:
01: 500 μs
10: 1.5 ms
11: 6.5 ms

Member.name: dtft
Member.description:
Exact timeout period that the device responds to the host. This field is valid when the DTCT is 0.
T = DTFT x 256 x 8 μs

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GBUSERRADD_HI
RegisterGroup.description: a global bus address error register.

Member.name: busaddrhi
Member.description:
Upper 32 bits of the error address
This field is valid only when GSTS[BusErrAddrVld] is 1.
This field is cleared only during reset, and it supports only the AHB and AXI bus configurations.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GBUSERRADDR_LO
RegisterGroup.description: a global bus address error register.

Member.name: busaddrlo
Member.description:
Lower 32 bits of the error address
This field is valid only when GSTS[BusErrAddrVld] is 1.
This field is cleared only during reset, and it supports only the AHB and AXI bus configurations.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GUSB2PHYCFGN
RegisterGroup.description: a global USB 2.0 PHY configuration register.

Member.name: phy_soft_rst
Member.description:
UTMI PHY reset by triggering the usb2phy_reset signal
In this case, the ULPI PHY is not reset, because it is reset by configuring the FunctionControl[Reset] register. When the core is reset, the core automatically configures vcc_reset_n, USBCMD[HCRST], DCTL[SoftReset], or GCTL[SoftReset] to implement reset.

Member.name: u2_freeclk_exists
Member.description:
Whether the USB 2.0 PHY provides the free_clk
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: ulpi_lpm_with_opmode_chk
Member.description:
0: In LPM mode, the controller transmits NOPID before transmitting EXTPID.
1: In LPM mode, the controller does not transmit NOPID before transmitting EXTPID.

Member.name: ulpi_ext_vbus_indicator
Member.description:
ULPI external Vbus indicator
0: The PHY uses the internal Vbus valid comparator.
1: The PHY uses the external Vbus valid comparator.

Member.name: ulpi_ext_vbus_drv
Member.description:
ULPI external Vbus indicator
0: The PHY uses the internal Vbus valid comparator.
1: The PHY uses the external Vbus valid comparator.

Member.name: ulpi_auto_res
Member.description:
ULPI automatic resume enable
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: usbtrdtim
Member.description:
USB 2 turnaround time, that is, response time after the MAC requests the packet FIFO controller (PFC) to fetch data from the DFIFO (SPRAM)
0x5 for the 16-bit UTMI+ interface
0x9 for the 8-bit UTMI+ or ULPI interface

Member.name: xcvrdly
Member.description: TX/RX delay. When this field is set to 1, the 2.5 μs delay is added between the time when Transceiver Select is set to 00 (high speed) and the time when TxValid is 0 to transmit the chirp-K handshake signal.

Member.name: enblslpm
Member.description:
Whether the utmi_sleep_n and utmi_l1_suspend_n signals connect to the PHY
0: The utmi_sleep_n and utmi_l1_suspend_n signals do not connect to the PHY.
1: The utmi_sleep_n and utmi_l1_suspend_n signals connect to the PHY.

Member.name: physel
Member.description:
PHY interface type
0: USB 2.0 high-speed UTMI+ or ULPI PHY interface
1: USB 1.1 full-speed serial interface
This bit is set to 1 when it is write-only.

Member.name: susphy
Member.description:
USB 2.0 high-speed/full-speed/low-speed PHY suspend
0: not suspended
1: suspended

Member.name: fsintf
Member.description:
Type of the full-speed PHY interface
0: 6-pin unidirectional full-speed serial transfer interface
1: 3-pin bidirectional full-speed serial transfer interface
When this bit is read-only, the return value is 0.

Member.name: ulpi_utmi_sel
Member.description:
Type of the high-speed PHY interface
0: UTMI+
1: ULPI

Member.name: phyif
Member.description:
Data width of the UTMI interface
0: 8 bits
1: 16 bits

Member.name: toutcal
Member.description:
High-speed/Full-speed timeout calibration
The corresponding bit time is added to each PHY clock.
High-speed mode:
One 30 MHz PHY clock = 16 bit times
One 60 MHz PHY clock = 8 bit times
Full-speed mode:
One 30 MHz PHY clock = 0.4 bit times
One 60 MHz PHY clock = 0.2 bit times
One 48 MHz PHY clock = 0.25 bit times

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GUSB3PIPECTLN
RegisterGroup.description: a global USB 3.0 PIPE control register.

Member.name: phy_soft_rst
Member.description: USB 3.0 soft reset

Member.name: hstprtcmpl
Member.description: PIPE PHY template test without the USB 3.0 cable

Member.name: u2ssinactp3ok
Member.description:
PHY state select in U2/SSInactive state
0: The PHY enters the P2 state.
1: The PHY enters the P3 state.

Member.name: disrxdetp3
Member.description:
RX detection enable in P3 state
0: If the PHY is in P3 state and the core requires RX detection, the core performs RX detection in P3 state.
1: If the PHY is in P3 status and the core requires RX detection, the core switches the PHY status to P2 and then performs RX detection. After detection is complete, the core switches the PHY status to P3.

Member.name: ux_exit_in_px
Member.description:
PHY state select when the core state is switched
0: The PHY is in P0 state when the core exits the U1, U2, or U3 state.
0: The PHY is in P1, P2, or P3 status when the core exits the U1, U2, or U3 status respectively.
Note: Set this field to 0 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: ping_enhancement_en
Member.description:
Timeout period changed from 500 ms to 300 ms for the ping command of the downlink port U1
Note: Set this field to 0 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: u1u2exitfail_to_recov
Member.description: When this bit is set to 1, and U1/U2 LFPS handshake fails, the LTSSM transitions from the U1/U2 state to Recovery state instead of SS Inactive state. If Recovery fails, then the LTSSM can enter the SS Inactive state. This is an enhancement only. It prevents interoperability issues if the remote link does not do proper handshake.

Member.name: request_p1p2p3
Member.description:
When the core state is switched from U0 to U1, U2, or U3, the core always requests the PHY to switch the state from P0 to P1, P2, or P3 respectively.
Note: Set this field to 1 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: delayp1p2p3
Member.description:
Delay when the state is switched from P0 to P1, P2, or P3
When the core enters the U1, U2, or U3 status, the time when the P0 state is switched to P1, P2, or P3 is prolonged until Pipe3_RxValid is set to 0 or an 8B10B error occurs.
Note: This function is valid only when bit 18 is set to 1.

Member.name: delay_phy_powerchange
Member.description:
PHY status switch delay
0: When the core status is switched from U0 to U1, U2, or U3, the PHY enters the P1, P2, or P3 status without detecting the values of Pipe3_RxElecIlde and pipe3_RxValid.
0: When the core status is switched from U0 to U1, U2, or U3, the time when the PHY enters the P1, P2, or P3 status is delayed until the values of Pipe3_RxElecIlde and pipe3_RxValid are 0.
Note: Set this field to 1 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: suspend_en
Member.description:
USB 3.0 PHY suspend enable
0: not suspended
1: suspended
Note: In DRD mode, set this field to 1 after the core is initialized.

Member.name: datwidth
Member.description:
Data width of the PIPE interface
00: 32 bits
01: 16 bits
10: 8 bits
11: reserved

Member.name: abortrxdetinu2
Member.description:
RX detection abort in U2 state
When this field is set to 1 and the connection state is U2, the core receives a U2 state exit signal from a remote device and RX detection is not performed.
Note: Set this field to 0 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: skiprxdet
Member.description: RX detection skip. When this field is set to 1, RX detection is skipped if pipe3_RxElecIdle is pulled down.

Member.name: lfps_p0_align
Member.description:
When the controller exits the U1, U2, or U3 state, LFPS signal transfer is stopped at the clock edge of the PHY P0 state request signal. Otherwise, the LFPS signal is transmitted one cycle earlier.
When the PHY state is switched from P1 or P2 to P0, the controller requests data transfer two clock cycles later after the PHY sets PhyStatus.

Member.name: p3p2_tran_ok
Member.description:
P2/P3 state switch
0: The PHY enters the intermediate status P0 each time when the PHY status is switched between P2 and P3.
1: The PHY is switched from P2 to P3 or from P3 to P2 without entering the intermediate status P0.
Note: Set this field to 0 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: p3exsigp2
Member.description:
P3 exit status select
1: When the core exits the U3 state, the PHY state must be switched from P3 to P2.
Note: Set this field to 0 when the Synopsys PHY is used.

Member.name: lfps_filter
Member.description:
LFPS filtering signal
1: The controller filters the LFPS signal from the PHY until pipe3_Rxelecidle and pipe3_RxValid are deasserted.

Member.name: polling_lfps_control
Member.description:
LFPS polling control after RX detection
0: (default) LFPS polling starts 400 μs later after RX detection.
1: LFPS polling starts after RX detection without delay.

Member.name: txswing
Member.description: TX swing of the PIPE interface

Member.name: txmargin
Member.description: TX margin of the PIPE interface

Member.name: txdeemphasis
Member.description: TX preemphasis of the PIPE interface

Member.name: elastic_buffer_mode
Member.description: Elastic buffer mode

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_USB3_GFLADJ
RegisterGroup.description: a global frame length adjustment register.

Member.name: gfladj_refclk_240mhzdecr_pls1
Member.description:
Precision of GFLADJ_REFCLK_240MHZ_DECR/ref_frequency
This bit is set to 1 when gfladj_refclk_lpm_sel is 1 and the decimal part is greater than or equal to 0.5.

Member.name: gfladj_refclk_240mhz_decr
Member.description: GFLADJ_REFCLK_240MHZ_DECR = 240/ref_clk_frequency

Member.name: gfladj_refclk_lpm_sel
Member.description:
SOF/ITP count clock select
If this bit is set to 1, ref_clk is the count clock.

Member.name: gfladj_refclk_fladj
Member.description:
SOF/ITP calibration value when bit 23 is 1
FLADJ_REF_CLK_FLADJ = ((125000/ref_clk_period_integer) ? (125000/ref_clk_period)) x ref_clk_period

Member.name: gfladj_30mhz_reg_sel
Member.description:
SOF/ITP calibration select
0: The controller calibrates the SOF/ITP based on the value of fladj_30mhz_reg.
1: The controller calibrates the SOF/ITP based on the value of PERI_USB3_GFLADJ[gfladj_30mhz].

Member.name: gfladj_30mhz
Member.description: When bit 7 is 1 and the SOF/ITP count clock is the UTMI/ULPI clock, the controller calibrates the SOF/ITP based on this field value.

RegisterGroup.name: sfc_dio_ctrl
RegisterGroup.description: a control register for the SFC_DIO functional pin.

Member.name: sfc_dio_ctrl_PU
Member.description: Input pull-up enable. The value 1 indicates enabled.

Member.name: sfc_dio_ctrl_SR
Member.description:
0: no SR (slew rate)
1: SR (recommended)

Member.name: sfc_dio_ctrl_DSx
Member.description:
Drive control
00: 4 mA
01: 3 mA
10: 2 mA
11: 1 mA
The value 10 is recommended when this pin is used as the SFC_DIO function, and the value 11 is recommended when it is used as other functions.

RegisterGroup.name: sfc_wpn_ctrl
RegisterGroup.description: a control register for the SFC_WPN_IO2 functional pin.

Member.name: sfc_wpn_ctrl_OPD
Member.description: Output pull-down enable. The value 1 indicates enabled.

Member.name: ci_dq3_ctrl_PU
Member.description: Input pull-up enable. The value 1 indicates enabled.

Member.name: ci_dq3_ctrl_SR
Member.description:
0: no SR
1: SR
When this pin is used as the SDIO0_CCLK_OUT function, the value 1 is recommended for the 3.3 V mode, and the value 0 is recommended for the 1.8 V mode.
When this pin is used as other functions, the value 1 is recommended.

Member.name: ci_dq3_ctrl_DSx
Member.description:
Drive control
000: 12 mA
001: 11 mA
010: 9 mA
011: 8 mA
100: 5 mA
101: 4 mA
110: 2 mA
111: 1 mA
When this pin is used as the SDIO0_CCLK_OUT function, the value 101 is recommended for the 3.3 V mode, the value 000 is recommended for the 1.8 V SDR mode, and the value 100 is recommended for the 1.8 V DDR mode.
When this pin is used as other functions, the value 111 is recommended.
